definition: lit. not to dig a well until one is thirsty/to be unprepared and seek help at the last minute (idiom)
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
Jing, one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/surname Jing

sentences.english: As the saying goes, "Dig your well before you're thirsty."
sentences.chinese: 老話說得好啊，不要臨渴掘井。
